LanguageData.DesignatorRemovePlumbingDesc: Designate sections of a pipe type for deconstruction.
LanguageData.RemoveSewageDesc: Remove sewage from the ground and place it into barrels.
LanguageData.DBH.requiresSaunaRoom: Room is too large to heat!\nMaximum of 50 cells per heater\nAdd more sauna heaters or shrink the room
LanguageData.DBHPrisonWaterEx: A prison cell has no access to drinking water, build at least 1 drinking water source like a water tub or basin so that prisoners have free access to drinking water
LanguageData.Alert_MissingTowerDesc: A water tower or water butt is required to store water pumped from wells.
LanguageData.Alert_MissingWellDesc: Pumps require a piped well to access ground water.
LanguageData.Alert_MissingPumpDesc: A water pump is required to pump the water from a well to a water tower.
LanguageData.DBHFalloutWarningEx:
After 2 days of toxic fallout the buildup will contaminate any water storage tanks connected to water wells.

Prepare by creating a reserve of water and then using a valve to disconnect the wells to protect the water from contamination before it is too late.

You can also use a deep well to access uncontaminated water, or install a water treatment system which will eliminate all contamination from water reserves.
LanguageData.LowCoolingCap: Low cooling capacity. You can increase the power of outdoor units.
LanguageData.BlockedSewage: A sewage outlet has become blocked.
LanguageData.BlockedSewageDesc: Sewage has built up around the drain hole and is blocking the outlet.\n\nBuild more outlets or add a septic tank to create a buffer and reduce pressure on the outlets.
LanguageData.LowWaterTempDesc: The water temperature in this tank is too low; colonists expecting to use hot water may get annoyed.\n\nTurn on boilers, increase the heating capacity, or add another hot water tank.
LanguageData.WellNeedsWater: Must be placed over a cell with ground water.
LanguageData.AssigningRequiresRoom: The fixture must be inside a room to restrict it.
LanguageData.AssigningRequiresBladderNeed: Assigning requires bladder need, but {0} doesn't have bladder need.
LanguageData.LetterBlockedDrain: A drain has become blocked. A cleaner must clean the blockage.
LanguageData.ContaminationAlertDesc:
A well has become polluted.

Sources of contamination:
{0}

Either move the well, remove the sources of contamination, or if you are using piped wells add a water treatment system, which will also clean contaminated water towers over time.
LanguageData.ContaminatiedTowerAlertDesc: A water tower has become polluted, posing a serious health risk to your colonists. Solve the cause of the pollution and then drain the tank, or build a water treatment system.
LanguageData.MessageHygieneDisease: {0} has contracted {1} because of bad personal hygiene
LanguageData.MessageWaterDisease: {0} has contracted {1} from drinking untreated water
LanguageData.MessageWaterDiseaseContaminated: {0} has contracted {1} from drinking contaminated water
LanguageData.CommandFixtureSetAsMedicalDesc: Limit this fixture to patients only.
LanguageData.ConnectFixturesToBedDesc: Connect the fixtures to a nearby bed so they inherit the ownership. Hold shift to assign multiple beds
LanguageData.ChangeOccupancyRestrictionDesc: Should pawns check if anything in the room is reserved before trying to use the fixture, prevents pawns from walking in on each other to use basins and toilets at the same time
LanguageData.OverrideThermostatDesc: Force the boiler to run continuously.
LanguageData.MustPlaceFreezerWithFreeSpaces: Exhaust vents must be kept clear!
LanguageData.ThermostatSetupWarning: Thermostat overridden by hot water tanks. Set all connected hot water tanks to thermostat mode.
LanguageData.HotWaterTankUseThermostatDesc: Turn on boilers for 1 hour when the tank temperature is low. If this is disabled then boilers will run continuously and ignore room thermostats.
LanguageData.NoUnreservedSource: No unreserved water sources of the highest available quality.
LanguageData.CommandDesignateOpenCloseValveDesc: Toggle the valve between open and closed.
LanguageData.DrainTankDesc: Drain the tank and remove contamination.
LanguageData.DrainSepticTankDesc: Set the level at which fecal sludge should be emptied into barrels. Fecal sludge can be moved and knocked over, burned, or turned into biosolids or fuel.
LanguageData.KickOverDesc: Spill this barrel of sewage on the ground.
LanguageData.AreaPlaceFertilizerDesc: Designate areas to fertilize with biosolids.
LanguageData.dbh.PriorityIndoorCleaningTip: Enables a higher priority cleaning job to clean indoors first
LanguageData.dbh.ModRemoveDesc:
Steps:

1: Save your game immediately after pressing confirm
2: Quit to the main menu and disable the mod and restart the game
3: Load your save game, ignore any exceptions and save it again
Load the save game once more and there shouldn't be any exceptions related to missing bad hygiene defs or classes!
LanguageData.fixtureQualityRequiresRestart: A restart is required to add quality and art comps back in.\n\n restart now?
LanguageData.fixtureQualityTip: Enable quality and art comps for fixtures like toilets
LanguageData.QuitToMenuToChange: Quit to main menu to change.
LanguageData.RimefellerLinkTip: Enable water usage on crackers and refiners in Rimefeller.
LanguageData.RimatomicsLinkTip: Enable water usage on cooling towers in Rimatomics.
LanguageData.OverrideNeedSettingsTip: Manually disable needs by body type, race, or active hediff.
LanguageData.PrisonersGetNeedsTip: Set if prisoners should have needs
LanguageData.PrivacyChecksTip: Colonists care about privacy when bathing or using toilets.
LanguageData.CoolingEfficiencyTip: Set if high temperature should affect cooling efficiency like standard AC
LanguageData.RainIrrigationTip: Rain will give the same boost as sprinklers. Might reduce game performance.
LanguageData.DisableNeedsTip: Disable needs entirely. Overrides all other settings.
LanguageData.AllowModdedDrinksTip: Pawns will also be allowed to drink and pack any modded drinks. VGP and RimCuisine drinks can be used default, others will require modding an extension to the def.
LanguageData.AllowDrinkPackingTip: Pawns will automatically pack water bottles into their inventory when they can.\n\nMay not work with some mods, for CE you will need to manually manage your loadout to include water bottles else they will keep dropping them.
LanguageData.PetsGetBladderTip: Enable bladder need on pets. Also adds litter boxes for pets.
LanguageData.WildAnimalsGetBladderTip: Enable bladder need on all wild animals. This could get messy.
LanguageData.ThirstNeedTip: Enable thirst need on all colonists with bladder need. Adds drinking fountains and water bottles. Requires a restart.
LanguageData.FertilizerVisibleTip: Set if the fertilizer grid should be visible
LanguageData.AllowNonHumanTip: Enables needs on non-human colonists. You can disable specific beings with the needs filter.
LanguageData.DBHLiteModeTip:
Switch the mod into a simplified mode which removes pipes, water and sewage management, and any buildings and jobs not directly related to hygiene and thirst.

This will prevent many defs from loading and requires a restart.

If you are trying to load a save with existing hygiene buildings you may need to save and reload it after activating
LanguageData.LiteRequiresRestart: You must restart the game to enable Lite mode\n\nIf you are trying to load a save with existing hygiene buildings you may need to save and reload it after activating to clear errors
LanguageData.PassiveWaterCoolersLinkTip: Passive coolers have their wood fueling removed and are instead filled with water, similar to water tubs.
LanguageData.sos2intTip: Adds water and sewage processing to life support, and adds pipes to ship structures.
LanguageData.HygieneWikiDesc: Go to the Bad Hygiene Wiki
LanguageData.SurvivalModeTip: Limits the default shallow water grid generation to very small patches. Terrain features no longer generate water, and the radius around surface water is reduced.\n\nA new game is not required; works with existing saves.
LanguageData.HydroponicsLinkTip: Powered growing buildings like hydroponics have water tanks that require filling from pipes. Plants die from lack of water instead of power, but water tanks only fill when the building is powered.
LanguageData.ThirstRequiresRestart: A restart is required to add and remove thirst-related items.\n\nRestart now?
